channel.title: confuring the CLI
channel.description: I know the CLI version of whonix is for advanced users but I don't think My PC has the resources to run the GUI adequately. Everything seemed to be going fine and I was presented with the Whonix welcome screen. My PC just froze with a blank black screen and had to force a reboot. Where can I find any documentation on how to set up the CLI version to use Tor and whatever else needs to be configured. I don't need to understand it, I just need to copy paste the commands.

item.title: confuring the CLI
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
use light wight stable secure gnu/linux distro like Debian and install kvm or virtualbox inside it. im running whonix on debian host with PC made before 12 years ago with 4G ram.

Read full topic

I know the CLI version of whonix is for advanced users but I don’t think My PC has the resources to run the GUI adequately.
